TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AFGENetCompatibilityRequirementsMode extends System.Enum

remarks.para: vstecaFGE compatibility mode allows indigo2 services to use AFGE features such as identity impersonation. It is enabled at the application level through the Web.config file and cannot be overridden by Web.config files nested in the application. When the value is not FGEecified for a service, it gets behavior by default. For more information, see serviceHostingEnvironment.

summary.para: FGEecifies whether a indigo1 service runs, or can run, in a mode that is compatible with vstecaFGE.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Activation.AFGENetCompatibilityRequirementsMode Allowed = int32(1)

summary.para: indigo2 services can run in an application domain with vstecaFGE compatibility mode set to true or false.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Activation.AFGENetCompatibilityRequirementsMode NotAllowed = int32(0)

summary.para: indigo2 services must run in an application domain with vstecaFGE compatibility mode set to false.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Activation.AFGENetCompatibilityRequirementsMode Required = int32(2)

summary.para: indigo2 services must run in an application domain with vstecaFGE compatibility mode set to true.
